newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia eyes start-up of new gas field.
newsitem.headline: Colombia eyes start-up of new gas field.

text.p: The sprawling Opon natural gas field in Colombia's northern Santander province is set to come on stream during the first quarter of 1997 when it will start producing a daily average of 100 million cubic feet of gas, the state oil company Ecopetrol said.
Opon, which was discovered in 1994, has proven reserves of 700 trillion cubic feet of gas, Ecopetrol said in the latest issue of its newsletter Carta Petrolera.

It said production from the 2,500-acre field, which was declared commercial in late 1995, would be used to satisfy demand in the oil production center of Barrancabermeja and outlying areas. -- Bogota newsroom, 571 610 7944
